attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bhhivquadq7ycnd/AAAIl8mVW9GCiOyGwk71At_ra?dl=0

attributes.action: Award QTS as part of EYITT
attributes.background: EYITT's have to meet the same entry requirements and the same set of rigorous standards as their counterparts who achieve QTS.
attributes.additional_details:
Without QTS, EYT's have found that they do not receive equal stature, pay or recognition for the demanding work that they carry out and their dedication, passion and commitment towards the teaching profession and children and families aged 0-5.

http://www.nurseryworld.co.uk/nursery-world/news/1159248/early-years-pay-and-conditions-survey-2016

https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/eligibility-for-teacher-training

attributes.action: I call for a vote of NO CONFIDENCE in this government!
attributes.background: Brexit is causing chaos to the United Kingdom and it's citizens, it is clear, the referendum as presented to the voter was based on lies and exagerations and the government is still continuing this trend, this must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Not allowing parliment to vote on when article 50 will be presented, nor allowing the majority of the United Kingdom to have a rethink, now that they know the real implications of the result of the advisory referendum.

attributes.action: Drop prescription fees for people with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: I am a 17 year old girl who has lived with and helped to look after my mum, who has suffered with Parkinson's Disease since 2007. I would like to petition again the fees of prescription charges for people with such diseases, after our local MP refused to help us.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a fee of £8.40 per item for medications, for someone like my mum who could pay a potential fee of £51.60 a month for a illness that she can not help, or can not be cured. With her "season ticket" she pays £132 a year!

In Scotland and Wales, prescriptions are free. Over 65's also do not pay, aswell as people with problems such as diabetes or thyroid disorders. 
This differs from people with chronic illnesses, who often can not work and get less money.

attributes.action: Introduce new traffic legislation to benefit motorbikes and emergency services.
attributes.background: Make it law that road users must move to the nearside in a traffic jam or when the traffic is stationery/slow moving, on multi lanes inner lanes move to the nearside and the outer lane move to the offside.   Allowing motorbikes and emergency services to filter/continue without risk of accident.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a motorbike rider of many years with an advanced riding certificate and a member of Blood bike Wales.  With more traffic users on the roads each year.  I find there to be the downturn/deterioration of courtesy and common sense within road users, more and more road users do not give way and sadly selfishly blocks the way of motorbike users during slow moving or stationary traffic.  

This would  increase safe passage for motorbikes and emergency services without affecting the road user!

attributes.action: Make mental health education compulsory in primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: Mental health education is still not part of the UK curriculum despite consistently high rates of child and adolescent mental health issues. By educating young people about mental health in schools, we can increase awareness and hope to encourage open and honest discussion among young people.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 children and young people aged 5 - 16 suffer from a diagnosable mental health disorder - that is around three children in every class. 

There has been a big increase in the number of young people being admitted to hospital because of self harm. Over the last ten years this figure has increased by 68%. 

More than half of all adults with mental health problems were diagnosed in childhood. Less than half were treated appropriately at the time. 

Source: YoungMinds

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum on the grounds that demographics have now changed.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, would like to request that a second referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the EU should be held, due to the indication that demographics are now likely to have changed across the UK and many voters regret their decision on June 23rd.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/brexit-poll-majority-uk-remain-eu-theresa-may-article-50-second-referendum-latest-a7395811.html%3Famp?client=safari

http://uk.businessinsider.com/brexit-vote-regret-leave-margin-victory-2016-10

attributes.action: Change the law. Make Civil & Family Judges accountable in law and to Parliament.
attributes.background: Most people do not know that currently Judges cannot be prosecuted for Judicial Acts. Most Judges are excellent, but some are not. This new law shall give us the people the right to challenge them. Only right in our modern society. Judges shall remain unelected yes, but accountable they must become.
attributes.additional_details:
This reform law shall make Judges accountable for Misconduct in Public Office if for example they fail to:

1 Disclose Conflicts of Interest with any person involved in a case they hear. 

2 Fail to inform the Police if they discover  evidence of crime in a Family or Civil case.

Secondly if a Civil Judge fails to adhere to, or enforce a Statute of Parliament, thus the will of Parliament, which is after all the will of the people, they can be brought to Parliament to face Contempt of Parliament

attributes.action: Delay invoking Article 50 until Expert Commission reviews impact of Brexit on UK
attributes.background: MPs should respect the wishes of the 63% of the electorate who did not vote to leave the EU, and demand that Article 50 not be invoked until Brexit proponents provide a fully developed plan for the process of leaving the EU, followed by an Expert Commission to assess its economic and social impact.
attributes.additional_details: "Leave campaign" MPs claimed that leaving the EU would mean: more money for the NHS; improved job prospects for UK residents through lower immigration; greater economic prosperity through reduced red-tape and renegotiated trading agreements with the EU and the rest of the world. Since the Referendum, these claims have been significantly reduced, and there is no Brexit plan. Parliament now needs to take responsibility to ensure that the outcome is as beneficial as possible for the British people.

attributes.action: To create awareness and delvelop treatment on Temporomandibular Joint disorders
attributes.background:
The symptoms of TMJD include facial pain, reduced mouth opening and headaches which can be very debilitating. 

PURPOSE: 
- patients need to know which treatments they can access 
- to create more TMJD centers on the NHS in all regions of the UK, not just London
- more research into TMJD.
attributes.additional_details: TMJD affects approx. 25% of the population. There are very few NHS clinics which provide TMJD treatment in the UK compared to the USA even though there are NICE Guidelines set out for TMJD, most patients who do not know that treatment is available.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Dangerous Dogs Act 1991'
attributes.background: Everyday innocent dogs around the UK are dragged from their homes, stuffed into kennel's with other petrified dogs away form their owners and are 'destroyed'. A large number of these dogs are just puppies and have never shown any signs of aggression. They are dying due to breed discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Its about time we started to realise that no dogs are dangerous, only owners. We have known this for centuries yet we still allow criminals to breed these types of animals excluded within the Dangerous Dogs Act and we have almost zero accountability over our pet owners within the United Kingdom. 

We must propose a new system in which owners/breeders are held accountable for their animal no matter what breed and encourage education rather than destruction with this issue.

attributes.action: Pause, plan and review before a decision on Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty.
attributes.background:
1. Wait 4 to 6 months to allow the parties to resolve their internal conflicts.
2. Take steps to address the divisions that the referendum has revealed in our communities.
3. Hold an independent enquiry into allegations of disinformation during the campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
4. Establish a clear plan of what Brexit would entail; for example, movement of people, economic and trading relations, rights at work, environmental legislation and the future of Projects currently receiving EU funding.
5. This plan should be subject to public consultation and democratic process, including the views of 16 and 17 year olds before a final decision is taken about whether to enact Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty.

attributes.action: A Clean Air Act for the 21st Century
attributes.background: Air pollution is silently and prematurely killing 40,000 to 50,000 UK citizens every year at an economic cost of nearly £54 billion. Sixty years on from the first Clean Air Act we need the same level of commitment to saving peoples lives today through a Clean Air Act for the 21st Century.
attributes.additional_details: Over the coming months ‘A Breath of Fresh Air’ SERA’s clean air campaign will be building support for an act, encouraging research, shaping policy changes and actions, working with a range of organisations and host discussions. This will help support a bold, robust and ambitious case for a Clean Air Act that is fit for the 21st Century. More than ever, following the referendum and the risk to EU protections we currently have, action must be taken now. Add your voice to make this happen.

attributes.action: Make sports playing fields dog free areas - we need to protect our children.
attributes.background: I am a grassroots football coach and am becoming increasingly angered by the amount of time spent picking up dog faeces before training and matches. Talking to coaches from around the country this is a national problem. TIME TO BAN DOGS FROM ALL PLAYING FIELDS for the sake of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
My club in the East End of Newcastle have pushed hard to protect the kids, however the irresponsible dog owners appear at times that the wardens aren't around.
We have been highlighted in the Newcastle Evening Chronicle and some people have been fined but the practice of being ignorant by some people just doesn't stop.

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: Delay EU exit until referendum campaigns are fully investigated for truthfulness
attributes.background:
The recent referendum was characterised by lies and twisted truth, with newspaper retractions and fact-finding services being needed daily.

We need to know whether the British public were deliberately misled, by whom, and by how much, before committing to this monumental decision.

attributes.action: To grant Reading (Berkshire) city status as a key hub in Thames Valley
attributes.background: Reading (Berkshire) has a population of 232,000 and is a key hub for the Thames Valley region.  Its importance should be recognised and given city status.  We the people of Reading are now asking the Lord Chancellor to recommend to the Monarch, the granting of city status to Reading.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading is a Vibrant City that contributes significantly to our economy and culture.  It is one of the largest towns worthy of City status.

The town applied in 2012 and was disappointed after a long application process.  It was not selected as one of the three cities chosen but we strongly believe that it should be chosen.

attributes.action: Discuss the competency of Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.
attributes.background: The Alexandra Hospital in Redditch is slowly being downgraded by the Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.  Why?
attributes.additional_details:
The people of Redditch, Studley and Bromsgrove are affected because:
The public transport links from Redditch to Worcester are poor.
Maternity and Paedeatrics have already closed at Redditch.
The consultants are leaving the Alexandra Hospital, so more wards are closing.
The parking at Worcester Royal Hospital is inadequate.
Worcester Royal Hospital cannot cope with more patients.

The government should launch an investigation into the Trusts finances and its actions to remove services from Redditch Alexandra in favour of Worcester Royal.

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: Give teachers the choice to retire at 55 with full retirement benefits.
attributes.background: Teachers can retire at the age of 55 but with reduced retirement benefits. The government should give teachers the choice to retire at the age of 55 with full retirement benefits (worked out by the number of years an individual has paid into their pension).
attributes.additional_details:
More teachers would choose to retire early and therefore could be replaced with newly qualified teachers. The benefits would be:
* Mature teachers who wish to retire early could do so without worrying about financial barriers.
* The teaching profession will be more appealing.
* If the teachers were to be replaced by newly qualified teachers, it would cost less.
* Happier schools with enthusiastic teachers who actually want to be there instead of having teachers who have no choice but to be there just because they can't afford to retire on the small fraction currently offered

attributes.action: Make it an act of treason to attempt to overturn legitimate elections/referendum
attributes.background: To attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action subverts the nation's democratic nature.
attributes.additional_details: It is an act of treason to aid the enemy: to attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action runs counter to the nation's democratic nature.

attributes.action: Force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay compensation to all season ticket
attributes.background:
I call on the government to force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay monetary compensation to all season ticket holders on Southern operated routes at a level of 20% of their season ticket value. 

GTR recently cut 350 services from all lines added to previous disruption, customers need compensating
attributes.additional_details: Www.bbc.Co.uk/news/uk-england-36701300

attributes.action: Make not having a changing bed and hoist in disabled toilets illegal
attributes.background: Many families with children who have conditions and impairments have to change their children on the floors of toilets. We believe that this is wrong. A safe and clean place to go to the toilet and be changed should be a human right. If you agree then please join us and sign here.

attributes.action: Childcare Element of Tax Credits, paid directly to Childcare providers.
attributes.background: As a group of Childminders we have all, at some point, experienced not being paid by parents/carers of the children we look after for childcare we have provided. Most of the parents/carers we work with receive the childcare element of Tax Credits, yet still fail to make payment.

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: To keep the Four Freedoms as defined by membership of the EEA even after Brexit.
attributes.background: All those who voted Remain and many who voted Leave are in favour of the Four Freedoms and accept that this includes Free Movement of People. These voters are the true majority. Restricting European migration was NOT an option on the ballot paper and should not, therefore, be a Brexit "deal breaker"
attributes.additional_details: For example, many small businesses voted Leave in protest of excessive EU regulations. Many more individuals voted Leave because they believed it would help fund the NHS. Plenty voted Leave to give the UK sovereignty over its own Laws. Others voted in protest of the Tory policy of austerity. Only a MINORITY of the voters voted Leave to control migration. The Government should, therefore, keep the Four Freedoms in the Brexit negotiations as is the wish of the voting majority.

attributes.action: Make our motorways safe. Keep the hard shoulders
attributes.background:
On 14th February 2015 my brother along with 3 other passengers were killed after a night out when their car had broken down on the hard shoulder.
Although the signs clearly stated the lane was for emergency use only, a driver continued to drive in the hard shoulder.
attributes.additional_details:
If the hard shoulder was for emergency use at all times this would never have happened.
This is not the first time people have been killed and it certainly wont be the last.
If we brake down on the motorway, where is our safe place?
We are all in unnecessary danger if we allow our motorways to have 'Smart lanes.'
70% of drivers feel unsafe driving on the motorway and there are concerns how long the gaps are to find a safe place to stop and many ignore the signs.

attributes.action: Ensure the standard of proof direction is enough to overcome false accusations
attributes.background: To convict, a jury must find a defendant guilty ‘beyond reasonable doubt’. Judges should be required to state to jury: “Defendants are innocent unless proved guilty beyond reasonable doubt; therefore if you have ANY doubts, and those doubts are REASONABLE, you must find the defendant not guilty”
attributes.additional_details: Defendants are supposed to be considered innocent unless they can be PROVED guilty. But this is often not, in reality, what happens. If a complainant makes a false allegation, maintains it during cross-examination, and comes across as more believable (despite lying) than the defendant, that defendant is generally convicted because the jury makes their decision based on whom they choose to believe rather than proof beyond reasonable doubt. Innocent defendants should be protected, not convicted.

attributes.action: Following EU Referendum, Brexit team to be formed from elected MEPs and MPs.
attributes.background: Most of our elected MPs do not understand the anti-democratic EU (or they would have campaigned for Leave). MEPs know its structures and the legislation we may be pushed to accept part of. In the national interest any legitimate Brexit negotiation team must comprise our elected MEPs and MPs.

attributes.action: Make H.M.S Illustrious a IWM National Heritage museum ship.
attributes.background: As of recent, word has surfaced that the MoD wants to sell HMS Illustrious, a Royal Navy Invincible class aircraft carrier to the scrap yard.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the history of HMS Illustrious, and the already unfortunate scrapping of her sister ships, she is the last real icon of British naval power in the 20th century. She is also a veteran of the Falklands war.

It would be a almost disrespectful to scrap a piece of our naval history, particularly for such a low price.

It doesn't make sense to essentially waste such an incredible ship. Please sign to have this icon become a national heritage museum ship for the Royal Navy's history.

attributes.action: Make a law about the ratio of staff to residents in a care home with dementia.
attributes.background: I have seen how things are run in my mother's care home and we are neglecting these vulnerable people. There are not enough staff for the care and well being of the residents. I am one of very few relatives who visit regularly. After all most of us will end up in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
Of course the answer is that more staff are needed
At the moment there is no law regulating the ratio of staff per resident, only guidelines set out by CQC, which in essence let the care home decide the best way to manage their staff. So it’s a money issue - care homes charge between £700 to £1000 per week. My mother is self funded so we are eating our way through her savings very quickly, she has a terminal illness just like many others but her treatment is not fre

attributes.action: Give grandparents the right to see their grandchildren.
attributes.background: I have not seen my grandchildren in over 3 years. Currently there is no law in place which allows grandparents to see their grandchildren. There should be a law in which we should see them regardless  of relations between the sets of parents.  there are 'no winners' with the current law.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter got a new partner and for some unknown reason he did not like us seeing our grandchildren. They have recently moved away and we now have absolutely no way of contacting or seeing our grandchildren.

attributes.action: Make 'puppy farm' licensing stringently regulated in the U.K. to avoid suffering
attributes.background: Some of the licensed farms hold >100 breeding bitches caged in less than 1 cubic meter, no daylight, nowhere to toilet having litter after litter, true breeding machines! Puppies are taken away too early adding more cruelty to these dogs' life making life unbearable for these intelligent animals
attributes.additional_details:
Regulate conditions for breeding dogs on licensed puppy farms. Breeding dogs have less protected rights than battery farm chickens and are scrupulously used as money makers by licensed farms. Some 'breeders' don't even bother to kill the bitches once they have had too many litters, they are just left to starve.
Regulate number of breeding bitches per licensed establishment, all to be kept in approved sized kennels with daylight and daily outdoor runs & regulate the number of litters per bitch

attributes.action: Reduce the age limit on breast cancer screening to 40.
attributes.background: too many friends gone through cancer at 40 and they didn't even know they had it.

attributes.action: Increase child maintenance service powers to investigate the self employed
attributes.background: Self employed people can hide earnings by dealing with cash in hand jobs and holding funds in their business accounts. By default the CMS won't investigate all associated accounts be it business or personal and often don't have the necessary powers to anyway to gather a true picture of income
attributes.additional_details: Children and full time carers are going without while irresponsible parents hide their true earnings. It should be illegal for individuals to do this and the CMS should have the powers and resource to do this from the offset for all self employed individuals. Full powers to look at recent and historic bank accounts, credit cards etc both personal and business in order to see a true account of earnings. Only then will the system be fair to struggling children and full time mothers and carers

attributes.action: Amend Housing Act 1988 to stop care home owners banning restricting and evicting
attributes.background: Your Voice Matters was set up after I was unfairly banned from a care home http://www.yourvoicematters.org.uk/rights2speakup4care  Providers possess the powers of a landlord. They can ban, restrict loved ones (or any professional) and evict residents; PRIVATE paying residents have no protection.
attributes.additional_details: The Care Act 2014 alleges residents fully or partially funded and placed by L.A.'s are protected under the Human Rights Act 1998, unlike self-funders. CQC guidelines (2/11/16) purport that residents are protected under Article 8 BUT the Housing Act 1988 provides ultimate powers for providers to ban, restrict and evict; some instigate malicious falsehood and staff will support as fearful of reprisals. For this reason The Housing Act 1988 needs amending. www.yourvoicematters.org.uk
attributes.creator_name: Jenny Moore - Your Voice Matters CIC

attributes.action: Remove rail franchise from Southeastern (Govia Ltd)
attributes.background: Southeastern provide a consistent poor service to their customers, causing genuine misery and despair to thousands of commuters in the South East. They put profit before customers and effect the daily lives of people who just want to get to work on time and in comfort. No more debating, take action!

attributes.action: All photoshopped/modified images of models to explicitly state their editing
attributes.background: We call for the Government to pass this simple yet awareness-raising law that ensures all edited images must state that they have been tampered with. We also hope to decrease the value that physical appearance has in our society, increasing the value of other qualities that truly make us human.
attributes.additional_details: The effect the media's portrayal of 'perfection' has on young people is that ‘self worth’ is based solely on an unattainable, generic, no-room-for-difference physical appearance. By passing this simple law stating that an image has been edited, by literally showing that models do not naturally look the way they are presented, we can raise awareness for the true beauty of ‘imperfections’, individuality and that gorgeous spectrum that is body-size. Reintroduce reality and humanity into the media.

attributes.action: WOMENS EQUALITY -PCOS sufferers deserve hair removal treatment on the NHS
attributes.background: As a woman with PCOS I suffer the effects of hair growth all over my body and face. It is embarrassing and degrading that as a woman I cannot feel feminine yet men are afforded the funding to be female and females are funded for treatments to be male. I deserve the same opportunities as do others.
attributes.additional_details: The nice guidelines do not warrant funding for hair removal treatments like electrolysis and laser treatments. The management of PCOS is not straight forward and generally becomes a weight related issue, however losing weight is difficult for women who have to suffer with PCOS due to the insulin resistant hormones and imbalances. More research needs to be done and this should be an equality right due to the nature of such a condition that removes a woman's ability to feel feminine in society.

attributes.action: All local council authorities must include childminders in free childcare scheme
attributes.background: Currently, it is not compulsory for local authorities to include childminders in any free hours childcare initiative. This is un-balanced and biased. Many parents prefer childminders as an alternative, for some, they need the flexibility. Childminders have to adhere to the same practices and rules.
attributes.additional_details: scma and care inspectorate sites will provide evidence of legislation and training.

attributes.action: Impose Economic Sanctions on Turkey.
attributes.background: The Turkish state has one of the worst human rights records in modern history, they are also the largest sponsor of terrorism in Syria, using Refugees as a political tool to manipulate foreign police and purging all opponents. This is dangerous. We must impose sanctions to bring Erdogan to heel.

attributes.action: Offer free 20 hours of childcare to all families, with children age 1 year plus.
attributes.background: There is a significant gap in the provision of childcare. Parents/carers are encouraged to return to work after averagely taking a year off after having a baby. But when working, they have little disposable income because it mainly goes on childcare.
attributes.additional_details: The Joseph's roundtree foundation has recently published findings which included: that 60% of in-work families are currently in poverty. Many social issues would be resolved if there were less financial and emotional strain on families. This type of policy would efficiently use all the talent lost when people start a family. It makes sense in these uncertain and difficult economic times. Let's make a difference to our future generations lives!

attributes.action: Stop MHRA Removing CBD Products From Sale! Patients Will Suffer!
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are at risk of losing the only medicine that works for them. Stop the removal of Cannabidiol (CBD) products from the UK market on November 1st.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst we welcome the move to schedule CBD as a medicine following clinical trials, it must be understood that completely removing it from the market with only 28 days notice is not sufficient time for patients to find alternative ways of maintaining their health. 

CBD is well documented through clinical research to be non-toxic and non-psychoactive and has no recorded negative side effects in humans, as well as being a powerful anti-inflammatory, anti-spasmodic and anti-epilepsy drug.

attributes.action: Establish a Tort of Malicious Misrepresentation
attributes.background: In several recent elections politicians and news media have promoted misleading and inaccurate information to the general public on matters of public interest, denying them the right to make an informed decision on these matters, or have an informed opinion on matters of public interest in general.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that a Tort of Malicious Misrepresentation would enable these individuals, bodies and organisations to be held accountable by a non governmental body such as a Jury with damages going to repair the damage through promotion of the accurate and true position.

attributes.action: Form all party commission into social care provision
attributes.background:
We ALL know social care is in crisis. We need a 'joined-up' approach to social care and health that is 
- realistic about both need and cost
- reduces the party political blame game
- thinks long-term
- recognises the urgency for radical reform

attributes.action: Reduce the women's retirement age back to 60.
attributes.background: Women work hard within the workplace and having to work many extra hours at home.

attributes.action: Allow British Syrian professionals to sponsor a family member to live in the UK
attributes.background: We as professional Syrians in the UK are struggling without being able to bring a family member from a war zone and sponsor them to live in the UK, while others come illegally and enjoy the privileges of living in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists under the age of 16 to wear a helmet
attributes.background:
If you ride a bicycle, you should wear a cycle helmet, it's common sense.
Sadly so many children ride on the road without one.
Many serious accidents that occur would be less serious if the child was wearing a cycle helmet.
Cycle helmets are not expensive but they save lives.
attributes.additional_details: Government figures show 16,727 children under the age of 16 were injured on the roads in 2014, a rise of 6.2 per cent compared to the 15,756 injured in 2013.

attributes.action: Get the M.o.D. to agree to a last minute bid to purchase the ex-HMS Illustrious
attributes.background: There is a new consortium currently negotiating with the M.o.D. with respect to purchasing the ex-Royal Navy Aircraft Carrier HMS Illustrious, which if allowed to proceed, would save her from the scrapyard and instead see her preserved as a heritage attraction for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The funds necessary to cover all aspects of the purchase are in place, thus all that is required is for the M.o.D. to agree, and this iconic ship - the last surviving Invincible Class Aircraft Carrier, can be secured as an asset for the nation, for present and future generations to visit. Despite having received several high value heritage bids, the MoD instead agreed a much lower value scrap deal, clearly not the best financial option for the taxpayer. She is still en route under tow to Turkey.
